meanings.definition: To make someone unable to think or feel properly
meanings.sent1: The loud noise seemed to stupefy the little boy.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news stupefied her beyond belief.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so amazing, it stupefied the audience.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset stupefied him into silence.
meanings.sent5: The complexity of the math problem stupefied the students.

meanings.definition: To shock or astonish someone into a state of bewilderment
meanings.sent1: The sudden appearance of the ghost stupefied the group of friends.
meanings.sent2: The incredible magic trick stupefied the entire audience.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog on TV stupefied the children with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie stupefied the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The speed of the cheetah stupefied the zoo visitors.
